description: The hosts trend dashboard displaying resources measurements over time - number of virtual machines, CPU, memory, and ethernet interface Tx/Rx.

links.title: Administration Portal: Hosts
links.tooltip: The portal does not display deleted hosts

panels.content: ###### This dashboard displays resource measurements (number of virtual machines, CPU, memory, and ethernet interface Tx/Rx) for a selected host over a selected period.

panels.description: This report displays the memory size for the hosts in the selected cluster, and over a selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- TR02-1 - This report returns the number of CPUs and memory size over time
-- for the hosts in the selected cluster.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.

-- Memory size
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(history_datetime),
    SUM ( CAST ( COALESCE ( memory_size_mb, 0 ) AS float ) / 1024 ) AS "Total Memory Size"
FROM
    v4_5_configuration_history_hosts
    INNER JOIN
    v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
        ON
            (
                v4_5_configuration_history_hosts.history_id =
                v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_configuration_version
            )
WHERE 
    -- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back
    $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
    AND v4_5_configuration_history_hosts.host_id IN ($host_id)
    AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom() 
    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
    AND    
        CASE
            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                THEN 1=1
            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                THEN delete_date isnull
        END
GROUP BY history_datetime
ORDER BY history_datetime

-- TR02-1 - This report returns the number of CPUs and memory size over time
-- for the hosts in the selected cluster.

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.

-- Memory size
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(history_datetime),
    SUM ( CAST ( COALESCE ( memory_size_mb, 0 ) AS float ) / 1024 ) AS "Total Memory Size"
FROM
    v4_5_configuration_history_hosts
    INNER JOIN
    (
            SELECT history_datetime, host_configuration_version
            FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
        UNION
            SELECT history_datetime, host_configuration_version
            FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
            WHERE
                history_datetime <
                    (
                        SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                        FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                    )
    ) AS hourly_daily
        ON
            (
                v4_5_configuration_history_hosts.history_id =
                hourly_daily.host_configuration_version
            )
WHERE 
    -- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
    $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
    AND v4_5_configuration_history_hosts.host_id IN ($host_id)
    AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom() 
    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
    AND
        CASE
            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                THEN 1=1
            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                THEN delete_date isnull
        END
GROUP BY history_datetime
ORDER BY history_datetime

panels.title: Hosts Memory Size (over time) (TR02-1)

panels.description: This report displays the number of CPUs for the hosts in the selected cluster, and over a selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- TR02-2 - This report returns the number of CPUs and memory size over time
-- for the hosts in the selected cluster.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.

-- Number of CPUs
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(history_datetime),
    CASE
        WHEN count_threads_as_cores = TRUE
            THEN  SUM ( COALESCE ( v4_5_configuration_history_hosts.number_of_threads, 0 ) ) 
        ELSE SUM ( COALESCE ( v4_5_configuration_history_hosts.number_of_cores, 0 ) )
    END AS "Total Number of CPUs"
FROM
    v4_5_configuration_history_hosts
    INNER JOIN 
    v4_5_configuration_history_clusters
        ON
            (
                v4_5_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id =
                v4_5_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id
                AND v4_5_configuration_history_clusters.history_id 
                    IN 
                        (
                            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                            FROM v4_5_configuration_history_clusters a
                            GROUP BY a.cluster_id
                        )
            )
    INNER JOIN
    v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
        ON
            (
                v4_5_configuration_history_hosts.history_id =
                v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_configuration_version
            )
WHERE 
    -- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back
    $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
    AND v4_5_configuration_history_hosts.host_id IN ($host_id)
    AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom() 
    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
    AND    
        CASE
            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                THEN 1=1
            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                THEN v4_5_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date isnull
        END
GROUP BY history_datetime, count_threads_as_cores
ORDER BY history_datetime

-- TR02-2 - This report returns the number of CPUs and memory size over time
-- for the hosts in the selected cluster.

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.

-- Number of CPUs
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(history_datetime),
    CASE
        WHEN count_threads_as_cores = TRUE
            THEN  SUM ( COALESCE ( v4_5_configuration_history_hosts.number_of_threads, 0 ) ) 
        ELSE SUM ( COALESCE ( v4_5_configuration_history_hosts.number_of_cores, 0 ) )
    END AS "Total Number of CPUs"
FROM
    v4_5_configuration_history_hosts
    INNER JOIN 
    v4_5_configuration_history_clusters
        ON
            (
                v4_5_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id =
                v4_5_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id
                AND v4_5_configuration_history_clusters.history_id 
                    IN 
                        (
                            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                            FROM v4_5_configuration_history_clusters a
                            GROUP BY a.cluster_id
                        )
            )
    INNER JOIN
    (
            SELECT history_datetime, host_configuration_version
            FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
        UNION
            SELECT history_datetime, host_configuration_version
            FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
            WHERE
                history_datetime <
                    (
                        SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                        FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                    )
    ) AS hourly_daily
        ON
            (
                v4_5_configuration_history_hosts.history_id =
                hourly_daily.host_configuration_version
            )
WHERE 
    -- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
    $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
    AND v4_5_configuration_history_hosts.host_id IN ($host_id)
    AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom() 
    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
    AND
        CASE
            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                THEN 1=1
            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                THEN v4_5_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date isnull
        END
GROUP BY history_datetime, count_threads_as_cores
ORDER BY history_datetime

panels.title: Hosts Number of CPUs (over time) (TR02-2)

panels.description: This report displays average memory usage and peaks for a selected host over a selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- TR02-3 - This query returns the hosts
-- memory usage over time.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(sub_query.time),
    MEM_Usage AS "Memory Usage"
FROM 
    (
        -- Hosts Max and Average Memory Usage Peaks
        SELECT
            history_datetime AS time,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( memory_usage_percent, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS MEM_Usage
        FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples AS samples
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by active hosts only
            samples.host_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
            AND samples.host_id IN ($host_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        GROUP BY history_datetime
    ) AS sub_query
-- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY sub_query.time, MEM_Usage
ORDER BY sub_query.time

-- TR02-3 - This query returns the hosts average
-- memory usage and peaks over time.

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(sub_query.time),
    MEM_Usage AS "Average Memory Usage",
    MEM_Peak AS "Average Memory Peaks"
FROM 
    (
        -- Hosts Max and Average Memory Usage Peaks
        SELECT
            history_datetime AS time,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( memory_usage_percent, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS MEM_Usage,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( max_memory_usage, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS MEM_Peak
        FROM
            (
                    SELECT history_datetime, memory_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, max_memory_usage, host_status, host_id 
                    FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                    SELECT history_datetime, memory_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, max_memory_usage, host_status, host_id 
                    FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
                    WHERE
                        history_datetime <
                            (
                                SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                            )
            ) AS hourly_daily
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by active hosts only
            hourly_daily.host_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
            AND hourly_daily.host_id IN ($host_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        GROUP BY history_datetime
    ) AS sub_query
-- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY sub_query.time, MEM_Usage, MEM_Peak
ORDER BY sub_query.time

panels.title: Average Memory Usage and Peaks (over time) (TR02-3)

panels.description: This report displays average CPU usage and peaks for a selected host over a selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- TR02-4 - This query returns the hosts
-- CPU usage over time.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(sub_query.time),
    CPU_Usage AS "CPU Usage"
FROM 
    (
        -- Here we get the hosts max and average CPU usage
        SELECT
            history_datetime AS time,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( cpu_usage_percent, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS CPU_Usage
        FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples AS samples
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by active hosts only
            samples.host_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
            AND samples.host_id IN ($host_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        GROUP BY history_datetime
    ) AS sub_query
-- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY sub_query.time, CPU_Usage
ORDER BY sub_query.time

-- TR02-4 - This query returns the hourly and daily hosts
-- CPU usage and peaks over time.

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(sub_query.time),
    CPU_Usage AS "CPU Usage",
    CPU_Peak AS "CPU Peak"
FROM 
    (
        -- Here we get the hosts max and average CPU usage
        SELECT
            history_datetime AS time,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( cpu_usage_percent, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS CPU_Usage,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( max_cpu_usage, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS CPU_Peak
        FROM
            (
                    SELECT history_datetime, cpu_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, max_cpu_usage, host_status, host_id 
                    FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                    SELECT history_datetime, cpu_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, max_cpu_usage, host_status, host_id 
                    FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
                    WHERE
                        history_datetime <
                            (
                                SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                            )
            ) AS hourly_daily
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by active hosts only
            hourly_daily.host_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
            AND hourly_daily.host_id IN ($host_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        GROUP BY history_datetime
    ) AS sub_query
-- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY sub_query.time, CPU_Usage, CPU_Peak
ORDER BY sub_query.time

panels.title: Average CPU Usage and Peaks (over time) (TR02-4)

panels.description: This report displays average number of virtual machines and peaks for a selected host over a selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- TR02-5 - This query returns the hosts
-- active VMs counts over time.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(sub_query.time),
    CAST ( VMS AS int ) AS "Number of Virtual Machines"
FROM 
    (
        -- Here we get the hosts Max and average active vms counts
        SELECT
            history_datetime AS time,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( active_vms, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS VMS
        FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples AS samples
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by active hosts only
            samples.host_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
            AND samples.host_id IN ($host_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        GROUP BY history_datetime
    ) AS sub_query
-- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY sub_query.time, VMS
ORDER BY sub_query.time

-- TR02-5 - This query returns the hourly and daily hosts
-- active VMs counts over time

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(sub_query.time),
    CAST ( VMS AS int ) AS "Avg. Number of Virtual Machines",
    CAST ( VMS_Peak AS int ) AS "Avg. Peaks of Number of Virtual Machines"
FROM 
    (
        -- Here we get the hosts Max and average active vms counts
        SELECT
            history_datetime AS time,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( active_vms, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS VMS,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( max_active_vms, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS VMS_Peak
        FROM
            (
                    SELECT history_datetime, active_vms, minutes_in_status, max_active_vms, host_status, host_id 
                    FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                    SELECT history_datetime, active_vms, minutes_in_status, max_active_vms, host_status, host_id
                    FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
                    WHERE
                        history_datetime <
                            (
                                SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                            )
            ) AS hourly_daily
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by active hosts only
            hourly_daily.host_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
            AND hourly_daily.host_id IN ($host_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        GROUP BY history_datetime
    ) AS sub_query
-- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY sub_query.time, VMS, VMS_Peak
ORDER BY sub_query.time

panels.title: Average Number of Virtual Machines and Peaks (over time) (TR02-5)

panels.description: This report displays for the top 5 busiest Ethernet interfaces the average transmit and receive rates for a selected host over a selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- TR02-6 - This query returns top 5 busiest
-- Ethernet Interface Tx and Rx Rates, over time

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(all_sub_queries.time),
    CONCAT 
    (
        COALESCE ( interface_name, MAX ( interface_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) || ' (', 
        COALESCE ( host_name, MAX ( host_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) || ')'
    ) AS interface_host_name,
    AVG ( Rx_rate ) AS "Avg. Rx",
    AVG ( Tx_rate ) AS "Avg. Tx"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id,
            CASE
                WHEN v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.delete_date IS NULL
                    THEN v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_name
                ELSE v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_name
            ||
            '*'
            END AS interface_name,
            CASE
                WHEN MAX (v4_5_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date) IS NULL
                    THEN MAX (host_name)
                ELSE MAX (host_name)
            ||
            '*'
            END AS host_name,
            statistics.history_datetime AS time,
            AVG ( COALESCE ( receive_rate_percent, 0 ) ) AS Rx_rate,
            AVG ( COALESCE ( transmit_rate_percent, 0 ) ) AS Tx_rate
        FROM
            v4_5_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_samples AS statistics
            INNER JOIN v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id =
                        statistics.host_interface_id
                    )
            INNER JOIN v4_5_configuration_history_hosts
                ON
                    (
                        v4_5_configuration_history_hosts.host_id =
                        v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_id
                    )
        WHERE
            history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the latest host interfaces configuration
            AND v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS a
                        GROUP BY a.host_interface_id
                    )
            AND v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT c.host_interface_id
                        FROM 
                            v4_5_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_samples AS b
                            INNER JOIN v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS c
                                ON 
                                    ( 
                                        c.host_interface_id = 
                                        b.host_interface_id 
                                    )
                            INNER JOIN 
                            v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples AS samples
                                ON 
                                    (
                                        samples.host_configuration_version =
                                        c.host_configuration_version
                                        AND samples.history_datetime =
                                        b.history_datetime
                                    )
                        WHERE
                            -- Here we filter by active hosts only
                            samples.host_status = 1
                            AND c.host_id IN ($host_id)
                            AND c.history_id 
                                IN 
                                    (
                                        SELECT MAX ( d.history_id )
                                        FROM v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS d
                                        GROUP BY d.host_interface_id
                                    )
                            -- Here we get or remove deleted entities according to what the user chose
                            -- in the "show_deleted" parameter.
                            AND
                                CASE
                                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                        THEN 1=1
                                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                        THEN v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.delete_date isnull
                                END
                        GROUP BY c.host_interface_id
                        ORDER BY
                                AVG ( COALESCE ( b.receive_rate_percent, 0 ) ) +
                                AVG ( COALESCE ( b.transmit_rate_percent, 0 ) ) 
                                DESC
                        LIMIT 5
                    )
            -- Here we get or remove deleted entities according to what the user chose
            -- in the "show_deleted" parameter.
            AND
                CASE
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                        THEN 1=1
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                        THEN v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.delete_date isnull
                END
        GROUP BY
            v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id,
            interface_name,
            host_name,
            statistics.history_datetime
    ) AS all_sub_queries
-- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY all_sub_queries.time, interface_name, host_name
ORDER BY all_sub_queries.time ASC

-- TR02-6 - This query returns top 5 busiest
-- Ethernet Interface Tx and Rx Rates, over time

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(all_sub_queries.time),
    CONCAT 
    (
        COALESCE ( interface_name, MAX ( interface_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) || ' (', 
        COALESCE ( host_name, MAX ( host_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) || ')'
    ) AS interface_host_name,
    AVG ( Rx_rate ) AS "Avg. Receive Rate",
    AVG ( Tx_rate ) AS "Avg. Transmit Rate"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id,
            CASE
                WHEN v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.delete_date IS NULL
                    THEN v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_name
                ELSE v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_name
            ||
            '*'
            END AS interface_name,
            CASE
                WHEN MAX (v4_5_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date) IS NULL
                    THEN MAX (host_name)
                ELSE MAX (host_name)
            ||
            '*'
            END AS host_name,
            statistics.history_datetime AS time,
            AVG ( COALESCE ( receive_rate_percent, 0 ) ) AS Rx_rate,
            AVG ( COALESCE ( transmit_rate_percent, 0 ) ) AS Tx_rate
        FROM
            (
                    SELECT history_datetime, host_interface_id, receive_rate_percent, transmit_rate_percent 
                    FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                    SELECT history_datetime, host_interface_id, receive_rate_percent, transmit_rate_percent 
                    FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_daily
                    WHERE
                        history_datetime <
                            (
                                SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly
                            )
            ) AS statistics
            INNER JOIN v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id =
                        statistics.host_interface_id
                    )
            INNER JOIN v4_5_configuration_history_hosts
                ON
                    (
                        v4_5_configuration_history_hosts.host_id =
                        v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_id
                    )
        WHERE
            history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
            AND v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS a
                        GROUP BY a.host_interface_id
                    )
            AND v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS a
                        GROUP BY a.host_interface_id
                    )
            AND v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT c.host_interface_id
                        FROM
                            (
                                    SELECT history_datetime, host_interface_id, receive_rate_percent, transmit_rate_percent
                                    FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly
                                UNION
                                    SELECT history_datetime, host_interface_id, receive_rate_percent, transmit_rate_percent
                                    FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_daily
                                    WHERE
                                        history_datetime <
                                            (
                                                SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                                FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly
                                            )
                            ) AS b
                            INNER JOIN v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces c
                                ON 
                                    ( 
                                        c.host_interface_id = 
                                        b.host_interface_id 
                                    )
                            INNER JOIN 
                            (
                                    SELECT history_datetime, host_id, host_status, host_configuration_version 
                                    FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                                UNION
                                    SELECT history_datetime, host_id, host_status, host_configuration_version 
                                    FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
                                    WHERE
                                        history_datetime <
                                            (
                                                SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                                FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                                            )
                            ) AS hourly_daily
                                ON 
                                    (
                                        hourly_daily.host_configuration_version =
                                        c.host_configuration_version
                                        AND hourly_daily.history_datetime =
                                        b.history_datetime
                                    )
                        WHERE
                            -- Here we filter by active hosts only
                            hourly_daily.host_status = 1
                            AND c.host_id IN ($host_id)
                            AND c.history_id 
                                IN 
                                    (
                                        SELECT MAX ( d.history_id )
                                        FROM v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS d
                                        GROUP BY d.host_interface_id
                                    )
                            -- Here we get or remove deleted entities according to what the user chose
                            -- in the "show_deleted" parameter.
                            AND
                                CASE
                                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                        THEN 1=1
                                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                        THEN v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.delete_date isnull
                                END
                        GROUP BY c.host_interface_id
                        ORDER BY
                                AVG ( COALESCE ( b.receive_rate_percent, 0 ) ) +
                                AVG ( COALESCE ( b.transmit_rate_percent, 0 ) ) 
                                DESC
                        LIMIT 5
                    )
            -- Here we get or remove deleted entities according to what the user chose
            -- in the "show_deleted" parameter.
            AND
                CASE
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                        THEN 1=1
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                        THEN v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.delete_date isnull
                END
        GROUP BY
            v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id,
            interface_name,
            host_name,
            statistics.history_datetime
    ) AS all_sub_queries
-- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY all_sub_queries.time, interface_name, host_name
ORDER BY all_sub_queries.time ASC

panels.title: Top 5 Busiest Ethernet Interface Tx and Rx Rates (over time) (TR02-6)

panels.description: Average transmitted and received total dropped packets of the host interfaces, over the selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- TR02-7 - This query returns the Ethernet Interface 
-- average Tx and Rx total dropped packets, over time.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.
SELECT DISTINCT
    time,
    CONCAT 
    (
        COALESCE ( interface_name, MAX ( interface_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) || ' (', 
        COALESCE ( host_name, MAX ( host_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) || ')'
    ) AS interface_host_name,
    AVG ( Rx_drop ) AS "Rx. Drop",
    AVG ( Tx_drop ) AS "Tx. Drop"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id,
            CASE
                WHEN v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.delete_date IS NULL
                    THEN v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_name
                ELSE v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_name
            ||
            '*'
            END AS interface_name,
            CASE
                WHEN MAX (v4_5_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date) IS NULL
                    THEN MAX (host_name)
                ELSE MAX (host_name)
            ||
            '*'
            END AS host_name,
            statistics.history_datetime AS time,
            AVG ( COALESCE ( received_dropped_total_packets, 0 ) ) AS Rx_drop,
            AVG ( COALESCE ( transmitted_dropped_total_packets, 0 ) ) AS Tx_drop
        FROM
            (
                SELECT history_datetime, host_interface_id, received_dropped_total_packets, transmitted_dropped_total_packets 
                FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_samples
            ) AS statistics
            INNER JOIN 
            v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id =
                        statistics.host_interface_id
                    )
            INNER JOIN 
            v4_5_configuration_history_hosts
                ON
                    (
                        v4_5_configuration_history_hosts.host_id =
                        v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
            v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_id IN ($host_id)
            -- Here we filter by the time range chosen by the user
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            AND v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS a
                        GROUP BY a.host_interface_id
                    )
            AND v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT host_interface_id
                        FROM v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts_interfaces
                    )
            AND v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT c.host_interface_id
                        FROM
                            (
                                SELECT history_datetime, host_interface_id, received_dropped_total_packets, transmitted_dropped_total_packets
                                FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_samples
                            ) AS b
                            INNER JOIN 
                            v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces c
                                ON 
                                    ( 
                                        c.host_interface_id = 
                                        b.host_interface_id 
                                    )
                            INNER JOIN 
                            (
                                SELECT history_datetime, host_id, host_status 
                                FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
                            ) AS samples_hourly_daily
                                ON 
                                    (
                                        samples_hourly_daily.history_datetime =
                                        b.history_datetime 
                                        AND samples_hourly_daily.host_id IN ($host_id)
                                    )
                        WHERE
                            -- Here we filter by active host only
                            samples_hourly_daily.host_status = 1
                            AND c.host_id IN ($host_id)
                            AND c.history_id 
                                IN 
                                    (
                                        SELECT MAX ( d.history_id )
                                        FROM v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS d
                                        GROUP BY d.host_interface_id
                                    )
                        GROUP BY c.host_interface_id
                        ORDER BY
                                AVG ( COALESCE ( b.received_dropped_total_packets, 0 ) ) +
                                AVG ( COALESCE ( b.transmitted_dropped_total_packets, 0 ) ) 
                                DESC
                                LIMIT 5
                    )
        GROUP BY
            v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id,
            interface_name,
            host_name,
            statistics.history_datetime
    ) AS all_sub_queries
-- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY 
    all_sub_queries.time, 
    interface_name,
    host_name
ORDER BY all_sub_queries.time ASC

-- TR02-7 - This query returns the Ethernet Interface 
-- average Tx and Rx total dropped packets, over time.

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.
SELECT DISTINCT
    time,
    CONCAT 
    (
        COALESCE ( interface_name, MAX ( interface_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) || ' (', 
        COALESCE ( host_name, MAX ( host_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) || ')'
    ) AS interface_host_name,
    AVG ( Rx_drop ) AS "Rx. Drop",
    AVG ( Tx_drop ) AS "Tx. Drop"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id,
            CASE
                WHEN v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.delete_date IS NULL
                    THEN v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_name
                ELSE v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_name
            ||
            '*'
            END AS interface_name,
            CASE
                WHEN MAX (v4_5_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date) IS NULL
                    THEN MAX (host_name)
                ELSE MAX (host_name)
            ||
            '*'
            END AS host_name,
            statistics.history_datetime AS time,
            AVG ( COALESCE ( received_dropped_total_packets, 0 ) ) AS Rx_drop,
            AVG ( COALESCE ( transmitted_dropped_total_packets, 0 ) ) AS Tx_drop
        FROM
            (
                    SELECT history_datetime, host_interface_id, received_dropped_total_packets, transmitted_dropped_total_packets 
                    FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                    SELECT history_datetime, host_interface_id, received_dropped_total_packets, transmitted_dropped_total_packets 
                    FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_daily
                    WHERE
                        history_datetime <
                            (
                                SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly
                            )
            ) AS statistics
            INNER JOIN 
            v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id =
                        statistics.host_interface_id
                    )
            INNER JOIN 
            v4_5_configuration_history_hosts
                ON
                    (
                        v4_5_configuration_history_hosts.host_id =
                        v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
            v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_id IN ($host_id)
            -- Here we filter by the time range chosen by the user
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            AND v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS a
                        GROUP BY a.host_interface_id
                    )
            AND v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT host_interface_id
                        FROM v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts_interfaces
                    )
            AND v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT c.host_interface_id
                        FROM
                            (
                                    SELECT history_datetime, host_interface_id, received_dropped_total_packets, transmitted_dropped_total_packets
                                    FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly
                                UNION
                                    SELECT history_datetime, host_interface_id, received_dropped_total_packets, transmitted_dropped_total_packets
                                    FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_daily
                                    WHERE
                                        history_datetime <
                                            (
                                                SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                                FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly
                                            )
                            ) AS b
                            INNER JOIN 
                            v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces c
                                ON 
                                    ( 
                                        c.host_interface_id = 
                                        b.host_interface_id 
                                    )
                            INNER JOIN 
                            (
                                    SELECT history_datetime, host_id, host_status 
                                    FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                                UNION
                                    SELECT history_datetime, host_id, host_status 
                                    FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
                                    WHERE
                                        history_datetime <
                                            (
                                                SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                                FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                                            )
                            ) AS samples_hourly_daily
                                ON 
                                    (
                                        samples_hourly_daily.history_datetime =
                                        b.history_datetime 
                                        AND samples_hourly_daily.host_id IN ($host_id)
                                    )
                        WHERE
                            -- Here we filter by active host only
                            samples_hourly_daily.host_status = 1
                            AND c.host_id IN ($host_id)
                            AND c.history_id 
                                IN 
                                    (
                                        SELECT MAX ( d.history_id )
                                        FROM v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS d
                                        GROUP BY d.host_interface_id
                                    )
                        GROUP BY c.host_interface_id
                        ORDER BY
                                AVG ( COALESCE ( b.received_dropped_total_packets, 0 ) ) +
                                AVG ( COALESCE ( b.transmitted_dropped_total_packets, 0 ) ) 
                                DESC
                                LIMIT 5
                    )
        GROUP BY
            v4_5_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id,
            interface_name,
            host_name,
            statistics.history_datetime
    ) AS all_sub_queries
-- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY 
    all_sub_queries.time, 
    interface_name,
    host_name
ORDER BY all_sub_queries.time ASC

panels.title: Top 5 Ethernet Interface Tx and Rx Dropped Packets (over time) (TR02-7)

list.definition:
SELECT DISTINCT   
    CAST ( datacenter_id AS varchar ) AS __value,  
    CASE          
        WHEN delete_date IS NULL  	     	    
            THEN datacenter_name 	 	
        WHEN delete_date IS NOT null  	      	    
            THEN datacenter_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'  
    END AS __text  		
FROM v4_5_configuration_history_datacenters  		
WHERE       		    
    history_id           			    
        IN               				
            (  	             					
                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		         					
                FROM v4_5_configuration_history_datacenters a  		         					
                GROUP BY a.datacenter_id 	         				
            ) 	 			
    AND datacenter_id  	         			    
        IN 			     				    
            ( 					 						
                SELECT DISTINCT datacenter_id 					 						
                FROM v4_5_configuration_history_clusters 					 						
                WHERE  					     						    
                    cluster_id 					         						        
                        IN 					             						            
                            ( 									 										
                                SELECT DISTINCT cluster_id 									 										
                                FROM v4_5_configuration_history_hosts  								 									
                            ) 					
            ) 	 			
    AND 	    			    
        CASE  	        				    
            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes' 	            					    
                THEN 1=1 		    					
            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No' 		        					    
                THEN v4_5_configuration_history_datacenters.delete_date ISNULL 	                
        END
list.label: Data Center
list.name: datacenter_id
list.query:
SELECT DISTINCT   
    CAST ( datacenter_id AS varchar ) AS __value,  
    CASE          
        WHEN delete_date IS NULL  	     	    
            THEN datacenter_name 	 	
        WHEN delete_date IS NOT null  	      	    
            THEN datacenter_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'  
    END AS __text  		
FROM v4_5_configuration_history_datacenters  		
WHERE       		    
    history_id           			    
        IN               				
            (  	             					
                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		         					
                FROM v4_5_configuration_history_datacenters a  		         					
                GROUP BY a.datacenter_id 	         				
            ) 	 			
    AND datacenter_id  	         			    
        IN 			     				    
            ( 					 						
                SELECT DISTINCT datacenter_id 					 						
                FROM v4_5_configuration_history_clusters 					 						
                WHERE  					     						    
                    cluster_id 					         						        
                        IN 					             						            
                            ( 									 										
                                SELECT DISTINCT cluster_id 									 										
                                FROM v4_5_configuration_history_hosts  								 									
                            ) 					
            ) 	 			
    AND 	    			    
        CASE  	        				    
            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes' 	            					    
                THEN 1=1 		    					
            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No' 		        					    
                THEN v4_5_configuration_history_datacenters.delete_date ISNULL 	                
        END

list.definition:
SELECT DISTINCT        
    CAST ( cluster_id AS varchar ) AS __value,  	
    CASE      	    
        WHEN delete_date IS NULL  	     		    
            THEN cluster_name 	 		
        WHEN delete_date IS NOT null  	      		    
            THEN cluster_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'  	
    END AS __text  	
FROM v4_5_configuration_history_clusters  	
WHERE       	    
    history_id           		    
        IN               			    
            (  	             					
                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		         					
                FROM v4_5_configuration_history_clusters a  		         					
                GROUP BY a.cluster_id 	         				
            ) 	 		
    AND cluster_id  		    
        IN 			     			    
            ( 					 					
                SELECT DISTINCT cluster_id 					 					
                FROM v4_5_configuration_history_hosts 				 				
            ) 		
    AND 	    		    
        CASE  	        			    
            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes' 	            				    
                THEN 1=1 		    				
            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No' 		        				    
                THEN v4_5_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date ISNULL 	    			
        END     		
    AND datacenter_id IN ($datacenter_id)

list.definition:
SELECT var_value
FROM history_configuration
WHERE var_name = 'EngineFQDN'
list.name: EngineFQDN
list.query:
SELECT var_value
FROM history_configuration
WHERE var_name = 'EngineFQDN'

list.definition:
SELECT COUNT (host_id)
FROM v4_5_configuration_history_hosts
WHERE 
    host_id IN ($host_id)
    AND history_id           		    
        IN               			    
            (  	             					
                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		         					
                FROM v4_5_configuration_history_hosts a  		         					
                GROUP BY a.host_id 	         				
            )
list.name: count_host_id_url
list.query:
SELECT COUNT (host_id)
FROM v4_5_configuration_history_hosts
WHERE 
    host_id IN ($host_id)
    AND history_id           		    
        IN               			    
            (  	             					
                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		         					
                FROM v4_5_configuration_history_hosts a  		         					
                GROUP BY a.host_id 	         				
            )

list.definition:
SELECT DISTINCT 
    CASE
        WHEN $count_host_id_url = 1
            THEN '-general;name=' || host_name
        ELSE NULL
    END
FROM v4_5_configuration_history_hosts
WHERE 
    host_id IN ($host_id) 	    
    AND history_id           		    
        IN               			    
            (  	             					
                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		         					
                FROM v4_5_configuration_history_hosts a  		         					
                GROUP BY a.host_id 	         				
            ) 
    AND delete_date IS NULL
list.name: host_name_url
list.query:
SELECT DISTINCT 
    CASE
        WHEN $count_host_id_url = 1
            THEN '-general;name=' || host_name
        ELSE NULL
    END
FROM v4_5_configuration_history_hosts
WHERE 
    host_id IN ($host_id) 	    
    AND history_id           		    
        IN               			    
            (  	             					
                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		         					
                FROM v4_5_configuration_history_hosts a  		         					
                GROUP BY a.host_id 	         				
            ) 
    AND delete_date IS NULL

title: 02 Hosts Trend Dashboard
